fact_check_explanation_title: The BMJ didn’t say PCR tests are useless
fact_check_explanation_summary: A social media post uses a BMJ article to support a claim about PCR testing, but doesn’t include some important context about the article it’s referencing.

fact_check_explanation_title: NHS says you should perform rescue breaths on children who aren’t breathing
fact_check_explanation_summary: A widely shared infographic suggests that CPR for children involves chest compressions only. But NHS advice is to also give rescue breaths (mouth to mouth).

fact_check_explanation_title: Instagram post gets it wrong about Covid-19 vaccines and animal testing
fact_check_explanation_summary: An Instagram post has repeated falsehoods about the survival rate for Covid-19 and vaccine testing on animals.

fact_check_explanation_title: Government modelling not proof of vaccine ‘genocide’
fact_check_explanation_summary: Estimates that most people who will die of Covid this summer will be vaccinated reflects the high rate of vaccination, not any harm of vaccines.

fact_check_explanation_title: Facebook post about poppy graffiti on mosque is misleading
fact_check_explanation_summary: A Facebook post about two men who defaced a mosque with a poppy picture doesn’t say what other offences they admitted.

fact_check_explanation_title: Vaccinated people are not warned against flying
fact_check_explanation_summary: This Covid-19 rumour has spread from Russia to Spain to Australia and the UK, but it isn’t true.

fact_check_explanation_title: The deadline for opting out of the NHS GP data collection has changed
fact_check_explanation_summary: NHS Digital will start collecting the data at the start of September.

fact_check_explanation_title: British Airways hasn’t told their pilots they don’t need Covid-19 vaccine
fact_check_explanation_summary: A Facebook post has also shared baseless claims that some airlines are considering banning vaccinated passengers.

fact_check_explanation_title: Herald suggests Scotland’s 2006 smoking ban behind drop in heart attacks since 1990
fact_check_explanation_summary: An article in The Herald misleadingly suggested the 2006 Scottish smoking ban was behind a 74% drop in heart attacks since 1990.

fact_check_explanation_title: The WHO hasn’t said women should be banned from drinking
fact_check_explanation_summary: Confusion seems to stem from a published first draft of the WHO’s global alcohol action plan, which talks about ‘appropriate’ prevention measures among women who are pregnant or of 'childbearing …

fact_check_explanation_title: Charles Bronson has not attacked Ian Huntley
fact_check_explanation_summary: The two men are in different prisons.

fact_check_explanation_title: You do not need a doctor’s letter to prove exemption from face coverings
fact_check_explanation_summary: Wearing face coverings in certain settings is now a legal requirement but you do not need a doctor’s letter to prove that you are exempt.
